results.title:
Sequential photographs
Motion Studies: Straight High Jump
results.credit_line: Courtesy Heritage Image Partnership Ltd / World History Archive / Welcome Collection / Alamy
results.brief_description: British American photographer Eadweard Muybridge laid the foundation of the moving image. Using multiple cameras triggered by trip wires, he captured a galloping horse in sequential images, reproduced them in a zoetrope and created the world’s first moving photographs.
results.credit_line_for_label: Courtesy Heritage Image Partnership Ltd / World History Archive / Welcome Collection / Alamy

details.label: Curatorial sections
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Pictures → 03. Time and Movement

results.title:
Gelatin silver print
Golfer
results.brief_description: American professor Harold ‘Doc’ Edgerton’s pioneering development of the electric stroboscopic flash suspended movement, stopping skipping ropes mid-swing – and even speeding bullets.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Partial Assembly
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: This partially assembled camera shows the many tightly packed components, including thermal management, circuit boards, microphones, image sensor and light filters hidden inside the camera’s body.
results.description: This partially assembled camera shows the many tightly packed components, including thermal management, circuit boards, microphones, image sensor and light filters hidden inside the camera’s body.

results.credit_line_for_label: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Image Sensor Assembly and Chassis
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description:
The chassis is the main structural element of the camera, and is die-cast with a magnesium alloy that is very light and strong.

The image sensor assembly with its large liquid cooled radiator is shown here mounted to the front of the chassis.
results.title_for_label: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Image Sensor Assembly and Chassis
results.description:

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Form Prototype
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: This prototype was built using a combination of stereolithography (SLA) and full colour 3D printed parts, which were made from a powdered material solidified by an inkjet printing process over hundreds of layers. It was used by the Blackmagic Industrial Design team during the early stages of design process to evaluate the camera’s design and functionality.
results.description: This prototype was built using a combination of stereolithography (SLA) and full colour 3D printed parts, which were made from a powdered material solidified by an inkjet printing process over hundreds of layers.
